conclusion: Plan to analyze the image to understand the layout and flow of liquid through the baffles.
The image shows three containers labeled A, B, and C with liquid flow, and three containers labeled D, E, and F below them connected by baffles.
Baffles are represented by colored lines positioned to direct the flow of liquid from top containers to bottom ones.
Liquid will flow out from containers A, B, and C.
Baffles are designed to direct the flow of liquid from A to D, from B to E, and from C to F.
Gravity will cause the liquid to flow downward, and baffles are angled to ensure liquid from A flows into D, from B into E, and from C into F.
By following the direction of the baffles and the flow of liquid, confirm that liquid from A will flow into D, from B into E, and from C into F.
